title: Web-Based Language Information Assessment Competency Enhancement Course (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic internet search proficiency, experience utilizing academic resources, and foundational vocabulary and grammar comprehension required for reading language materials
context.additional_context: Students must develop the ability to select and evaluate reliable web-based linguistic information to perform project-based assignments in language fields. This course emphasizes linguistic approaches such as text analysis, source verification, and academic expression evaluation.

learning_goals: Learners analyze web-based language materials applying ≥3 information reliability criteria (author expertise, source credibility, information recency, etc.).
Learners can select reliable language-related information with ≥80% accuracy on a given topic.
Learners reflectively review their information evaluation process through peer feedback and propose improvements for critical reading and expression.

resources: Web Information Samples on Diverse Topics

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
